author: Jonathan Eakin
comment: The Sony SW2 watch is just a disappointing but pretty glass slab without this app.  Would not have bought the watch if I didn't find this app first.  Exchange/Office 365 notifications are essential.  The setup UI has a steep learning curve, it's not intuitive.  Worth the effort.  Developer responds quickly.

author: Malcolm Howard
comment: The app has to stop keeping screen on. It is now becoming a battery killer.   It was an amazing app until this starting happening. Please fix.Would like other integrations with common apps.  Also notifications from this app freezes phone from time to time.   Also interrupts other apps.

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: Which smart watch are you using. I have an Android 7.0 version that is much better for Wear - email for that version. Not updating app store just yet.

author: Grzegorz Pszkit
comment: The app is great and is my essential for smart watch. However, recently it stopped vibrating. Settings seems to be all right. Anyone experienced this?
title: No vibration?

author: Michael Taylor
comment: Now accepting Weather Underground API developer key again.

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: Can you move to Sky Weather?

author: Rampanmont Sonthitiwitoon
comment: All works fine after I reinstall this app. Thanks.

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: Suggest delete all augmented widgets and re-provisioning them - latest version has more widgets and very stable.

author: Alex Bellamy
comment: Took a little while to setup and is a little quirky at times, but overall it has turned my Sony Smartwatch 2 from a expensive timepiece into an invaluable time saving and notification device with time options!  Being able to place information 'widgits' directly onto the watchface is a great feature so even if I miss a notification I can glance down and see it on the standard watchface.   The rain and weather notifications are extremely useful also!  The only features I'd like to see would be a black/white list for notifications from certain apps (One app I have sends lots of notifications with only a few key words for ones I actually care about), and a way to prevent rapid fire notifications (A cooldown time between notifications or vibrations if they come in fast).

author: Andrew Cooper
comment: Negative start so I could talk to another crash at my phone and a piece of crap the note for

author: Denise Arkwright
comment: Cant get app too start watch and connect sony watch

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: send me an email we can get this working

author: Charles H Boykins
comment: I want to Thank the developers of this project. Your motivation for expanding the capabilities of the Smartwatch, (I'm sure) is a midnight-oil-burning process. Please, by all means, Keep up the great/hard work (particularly for  LG Urbane), when further development permit. I use the New  Samsung Galaxy Note 5.
title: Gadget Particular Consumer

author: Miqdad Raza
comment: How do I make this work with metawatch?

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: depends on which Metawatch software you use - use the show on status bar option in augmented other settings.

title: Doesn't work with metawatch

author: Tony Nickerson
comment: I now rate this app as above.the team were very helpfull helping me get the best from this app.LOVE IT

author: Clifford Pascal
comment: Any chance of cleaning up the png image files for the message notifications on the edge? Great app but they are very poor quality image files.
title: Low resolution

author: Lester Billings
comment: I've come back a year later to try my luck with this app. Unfortunately it's still a GUI nightmare. Uninstall.
title: Quick help is about 1000 words

comment: It's really good. However I keep getting a notification saying null null null?????
title: Only 1 issue other great

author: Mark Sansom
comment: Problems after update to lollipop, all sorted now, thanks
title: SW2

author: Andrew S
comment: Great little app, I particularly like the 'next appointment ' widget that can be added to the Sony custom watchface.  Oddly though it disappears if I turn my phone on and off and I have to manually add it back in to the custom watchface.  Any idea why this might be happening?
title: Great additions

author: Jake Martin
comment: Packed with custom features this app  shows how smartwatches should and could operate straight out the box. It works well with Sony Smartwatch 3 SWR50.
title: Puts the smart into Smartwatch

author: cozma cosmin
comment: Information on the watchface disappear without any Ideea, it's drain the battery in one day. Need to refund this
title: stop working, frustrating, hard to use

author: Randy Penn
comment: Like it, but is there a way to keep the main screen from lighting up after the edge screen goes off?

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: not with current APIs - unfortunately. Waiting for Samsung to help with a Edge display specific API (open to 3rd party developers).

title: Nice on Edge

author: TeNeal Metcalf
comment: No improvement over base metawatch manager. Wasted money.
title: Doesn't improve functionality

author: erwin ray
comment: I did activate it in the notification,  but its still not coming on the edge..  Thanks

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content:
Just to confirm other alerts from other apps show - just not whatsapp?

Note augmented smartwatch pro needs to be enabled for notification access in system settings.

title: Whatsapp help

author: John Leslie David Cookson
comment: Helpful

author: Clarice Bonney
comment: This is what I expected the note edge to have stock so I love the concept! Is there a way to slow down the picture of the contact that flashes during text and to keep the message scrolling for the full 10 second I put it on? That would be great. Just downloaded app but so far excited about it. Thank you

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: Thanks - The contact picture will flash in a slower mode in the next update of Augmented Edge 1.8

author: Alejandro Sisul
comment: I had my Sony Smartwatch 1 for 3 years now and it is good only because this app.
title: Great work and most important great support

comment: Works very well on my note edge screen, thanks :-)
title: Great app!

author: gerarde connolly
comment: There seems to be very little in the way of support for the great little Sony smartwatch LiveView witch is a shame as this is a great device :(

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: Please email me you need to install version 5.6 then upgrade to latest. A sony issue I am working around. It works wells still on the SW1!

title: As usual doesn't work with Sony smartwatch 1

author: Chester Whiseant
comment: This is just what I was looking for to extend my MOTOACTV. Mine is rooted, but I don't always have WiFi and my Verizon plan doesn't support tethering  so non-stock notifications weren't happening. Now if only someone would come up with a native "post to Strava" solution, it would be perfect.
title: Perfect addition to my MOTOACTV

author: Dave McLaughlin
comment: Had this for my old Metawatch and then it was unused for a year or so until I got the LG G Watch R and now it's back on the phone. Makes Android wear even better.
title: What this watch needed

author: Ciaran Davitt
comment: App adds core functionality to android wear in its infancy.  Developers were very helpful with an issue I had and even sent me a new version to use before release.  Great application
title: Great app and helpful developers

author: Gelo Goloy
comment: Lack of clear documentation. Had a refund.

author: Kristina Taylor
comment: THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR MAKING THIS APP! I HAVE BEEN USING A SAMSUNG GEAR LIVE WHICH WAS PERFECT (WITH A GALAXY S5 PHONE). I SIMPLY NEEDED A WATCH THAT HAD A MORE BUSINESS LOOK TO IT. AND WHEN I SWITCHED TO THE ASUS ZENWATCH I WASN'T SO HAPPY. THE VIBRATION WAS SO WEAK I COULD HARDLY FEEL IT & NOTIFICATIONS WEREN'T VIBRATING. WELL.....AFTER BUYING YOUR APP EVERYTHING VIBRATES JUST THE WAY IT NEED IT TO! YOU SAVED ME A TRIP TO RETURN MY ASUS ZENWATCH!! I'M SO HAPPY & GRATEFUL TO YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO MAKE THIS. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO EVERY ANDROID WEAR USER 100%! IT IS WELL WORTH THE VERY LOW COST! I SEE SOME OF THE REVIEWS SAY IT DOESN'T WORK WITH LOLLIPOP WHICH IS ROLLING OUT THIS WEEK. ARE YOU WORKING ON IT SO IT WILL CONTINUE TO WORK AFTER THE UPDATE MAKES ITS WAY TO ME????
title: PERFECT JUST WHAT I NEEDED !!!!!!!!!!!

author: Hakemz R-Man
comment: I'd tested the notification and what the hell it was so delayed and took about 6-7 seconds before the test notification appeared on my watch. Please fix this. I used S3 lte.

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: Are you using notification access for alerts? if not switch to that (instead of accessibility)

title: Broken after latest update

author: Clark Wilson
comment: This app qualitatively improved the usefulness and fun of my Smartwatch2. It gives very detailed control of behaviors and adds new info sources like the weather microforecasts.
title: Amazingly cool

reply.content:

author: Brandon Needham
comment: App only does military time. Even with SmartWatch set to 12hr. unless I can't find the setting... Edit: thank you for your support! 5 stars!

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content: go to optimized notifications in Augmented settings, scroll down and enable "use AM/PM"

title: AM I Missing something?

author: Jeremy Frost
comment: Love the truly hands-free abilities this gives phone through my smartwatch. It just doesn't look pretty and I wish I could turn up my phone's volume through my watch
title: Awesome app

author: Pjay Pender
comment: EDIT: Thank you to dev (belatedly) for pointing out that it can be used for some smart watches and not all of them. Amazing app for Pebble. I'm sure it's helpful on other platforms too, for some needs.  Great app. Recommended.>>>>>  The lack of documentation made it very difficult to figure out how to use it with Pebble, but once I did, I encountered another problem. I now have multiple smart watches. It does different things with Pebble than the two Android a Wear watches, and while it's useful for Pebble I can't stop it from affecting Wear as well. It's also not quite what I want for my Sony SmartWatch 2. Any way to have it on for one watch but off for another? Five stars if I could use it for Pebble and not for Wear or SW2?

reply.author: Augmented Views
reply.content:
you should be able to disable to Wear and SW2 - just uncheck the respective options for these watches in Augmented Smartwatch.

Email me if still not working.

author: Micah G
comment: Great developer, but program didn't fit my needs.. Seems like it will do anything if you know how to use it!

author: William Velez
comment: The app works very well and adds value.  The tech support and its response time is unparalleled. I highly recommend the product.  I look forward to future updates.
title: Enterprise level support.

author: Sequ Daz
comment: Incredibly useful app
